result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan J. Raduechel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to all other sentences.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week.

Participate in any assessment, treatment & counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 
DNA sample. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to all other sentences.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan J. Raduechel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 12CF836, 14CF836, 14CF522, 14CF523, filed in 15CF131)

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:19 a.m. 
**Includes 12CF836, 14CF522, 14CF523 & 15CF131**
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Robin Kennedy. Date & time set for Motion to revoke DEOJ in 12CF836, Sentencing Hearing on Revocation in 14CF522 & 14CF523,  Preliminary Hearing & Plea/Sentencing Hearing in 15CF131. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ in 12CF836. COURT GRANTS. 
COURT ORDERS:12CF836 Ct.1- 3 years WI State Prison System, 1 year IC & 2 years ES concurrent to all other sentences. CONDITIONS of ES: Participate in any assessment, treatment & counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, AODA and any follow up, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week, DNA sample & surcharge, CC, absolute sobriety, restitution in the amount of $250.00 be paid to B.J. Defendant is entitled to 62 days credit. 
12CF836 Ct.2-  9 months imprisonment concurrent to all other sentences. Defendant is entitled to 62 days credit. 
State recites agreement re: Sentencing after Revocation on 14CF522 & 14CF523. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF522- Ct.2-  90 days imprisonment concurrent to all other sentences, CC & DNA surcharge. Defendant is entitled to 62 days credit. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF523- Ct.2-  9 months imprisonment concurrent to all other sentences plus CC & DNA surcharge. Defendant is entitled to 62 days credit. 
Parties are ready to proceed with Preliminary Hearing & Plea/Sentencing Hearing in 15CF131. 
Defendant wishes to waive right to Preliminary Examination.
Court questions deft as to waiver and states his rights. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed by State by the end of today (04/10/15)
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to DRI Ct.2-Bail Jumping (Felony), DRI Ct.3-Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (Repeater) and DRI Ct. 4-Possess Drug Paraphernalia (Repeater)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 3 years WI State Prison System, 1 year IC & 2 years ES concurrent to all other sentences. CONDITIONS of ES: Participate in any assessment, treatment & counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, AODA and any follow up, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week, DNA sample & surcharge, CC and absolute sobriety. Defendant is entitled to 62 days credit. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.
Adj: 9:37 a.m.
Absolute sobriety from drugs; or unless valid prescription for meds.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
